attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Despite overwhelming public outrage, developers have received permission to demolish The New Piccadilly Café in London's Soho. The Café is due to close on Saturday 22nd September, and unless the decision is reversed the area will be reshaped as yet another office, domestic and retail development. This petition is to serve notice that we, the undersigned, feel that a surfeit of thoughtless and greedy planning decisions are in danger of excising the very soul of our capital, leaving a characterless, sanitised, corporate wasteland in its place.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
